title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Acted
Interview Descriptions:
I applied for a program manager position in an Afrian country. The HR interview was pretty straightforward and typical HR questions: self presentation, why ACTED, what would my previous employers say about me.
The second interview was harder. it was with 3 people: country director, HR in HQ and a project coordinator. 
It was quite frustrating because they kept saying that they were interested in my profile, which gave me false hope, as I received an email 2 weeks later saying that I wasn't selected for the position.
Interview Questions: They asked technical questions on difficulties that I could encounter in distribution projects, how would I react if we crossed armed groups in the country, do I feel confortable dealing with armed groups and negociating access, and lots of "what would i do in a specific situation".

title: Environment and Climate Change Interview

title: AME Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Acted (Paris) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Applied to position about 1 week after posted. Heard back from HR representative about 1 week later to be invited to first screening interview. First interview was with HR rep over Skype, audio only, about 45 min interview, interviewer was friendly and personable. We covered far more questions than I expected during the timeframe, but most were straightforward.  Asked detailed questions about experience - be able to speak to your experience as it relates to everything in the job description.  Very helpful to Look at other Acted interview reviews on glass door - all the questions mentioned were asked. 

A few days later I was invited to schedule a 2 hour technical test. Focused on monitoring and evaluation activities - both technical knowledge as well as applying M&E skills to a task and answering questions. There is a lot to complete in 2 hrs so time management is key and I think this was my downfall. The HR rep followed up shortly after to inform me that I did not move forward to the next stage (interview). Overall it was a positive experience.
Interview Questions: Something you’ve done in professional experience you are proud of?

title: AME Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Acted (Paris) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Weird, negative interview process, I've done it a few times. The recruitment officer (always an entry-level, sort of robot-like HQ staff member) calls and asks you to turn your video on, while they keep if off. Then they rattle off a list of pre-written questions (who are our donors? what do we do? how many times have you done an assessment? etc.) and transcribe your answers. It is unlikely they know anything about the actual position, or understand how your skillset relates. Save your technical prep for later interviews, because this is basically a checklist. If you manage to pass this troll under the bridge, then you get a technical test, and only after the technical test do you finally get to speak to people about the position who actually might know what they're talking about. 

Acted is notorious within the sector for hiring early 20-somethings with little to no experience and throwing them into field-based positions that are over their heads (or, recruitment officer positions with no background in the humanitarian sector). It is also notorious for having a frustratingly silly hiring process. 

I will commend them for being very upfront about salary. The salary offered for an AME officer is like 1600 euros a month + a few hundred extra for expenses.
Interview Questions: Who are our donors?
